adjectives.description: thoroughpaced (comparative more thoroughpaced, superlative most thoroughpaced)

entries.meaning: (of a horse) Trained in every pace.
examples: I, who found it hard matter to keep up my less thoroughpaced steed with the speed of her perfect little Pegasus,  […]

entries.meaning: Extensively trained or schooled; knowledgeable; proficient.
examples: Wood's character of him is, that — "he was an exact mathematician, a curious calculator of nativities, a general read scholar, a thorough-paced philologist, and one that understood the surveying of lands well.  […]

The improbability of a thoroughpaced scoundrel writing daily elaborate confessions of his criminality to a friend, even when the friend condemns him, expatiating upon atrocities that deserved hanging, and justifying his vices on principle, is rather too glaring to be admissible.
